titleInfo.title: One Hundred and Fifty Dollars Reward.

subject.geographic: No 65 Baronne street, New Orleans, La
No. 65 Baronne street, New Orleans, La

mods.abstract: ONE HUNDRED AND FIFTY DOLLARS REWARD--Ran away or stolen on Thursday, the 14th, a dark Mulatto Boy, named JOHN, aged 12 years, medium size for his age, speaks French and broken English, had on a trader's suit; supposed to have been stolen by a man about 5 feet 7 or 8 inches in height, sandy hair and light whiskers, stout built, good address and very talkative, and aged about 38 or 40 years. $20 will be paid if taken in the State; if taken out of the State $50, and $100 for the conviction of the thief. Apply to the subscriber at No. 65 Baronne street, New Orleans, La. W. J. PIERCE. ja20 1m
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )

detail.title: New Orleans daily crescent. ([New Orleans, La.]) 1851-1866

mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
